diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute Cholecystitis s/p Laparoscopic cholecystectomy converted to open
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a five-day history of epigastric and right upper quadrant pain, which was progressive and associated with nausea and emesis. Physical exam revealed tenderness in the RUQ and epigastrium. Imaging (ultrasound) demonstrated gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, and cholelithiasis, alongside elevated liver function tests and lipase, supporting the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
